==== Coverage ====

 - more ideal would be testing across all 4 regions and better coverage across instance types
==== Testing the kernel ====
Note: The following tests are all part of the "QA Regression Test Suite", as defined at the Test Automation Sprint.

===== Setup =====

1. SSH into it

2. <code>sudo apt-get install build-essential make bzr libc6-dev-i386 execstack libcap2-bin exim4</code>

===== Autotest =====

3. <code>wget  http://test.kernel.org/releases/0.12.0/autotest-client-0.12.0.tar.bz2</code>  (kernel.org autotest client)

# tar -xjf the beast
# (autotest-1) run <code>autotest-client-0.12.0/bin/autotest autotest-client-0.12.0/tests/dbench/control > test-dbench.out 2>&1</code>
# (autotest-2) run <code>autotest-client-0.12.0/bin/autotest autotest-client-0.12.0/tests/tbench/control > test-tbench.out 2>&1</code>
# (autotest-3) run <code>autotest-client-0.12.0/bin/autotest autotest-client-0.12.0/tests/signaltest/control > test-signaltest.out 2>&1</code>
# (autotest-4) run <code>sudo autotest-client-0.12.0/bin/autotest autotest-client-0.12.0/tests/tiobench/control > test-tiobench.out 2>&1</code>
# (autotest-4) run <code>sudo autotest-client-0.12.0/bin/autotest autotest-client-0.12.0/tests/real_time_tests/control > test-real_time_tests.out 2>&1</code>
4. save the logs: <code>tar -cjf autotest.tar.bz2 test*.out</code>

5. from your machine, grab the results tarball: <code>scp ubuntu@<ec2-instance>:autotest.tar.bz2</code>

===== QA Regression Testing =====

/!\ We should call this something else, since it's confusing to call it the "QA Regression Testing". It's now only one test in the "QA Regression Test Suite"

1. SSH into it

2. <code>bzr branch lp:qa-regression-testing</code>
# <code>cd qa-regression-testing/scripts</code>
# run the scripts:
** <code>python test-kernel-aslr-collisions.py -v </code>
** <code>python test-kernel.py -v</code>
** <code>sudo python test-kernel-root-ops.py -v</code>
** <code>sudo python test-kernel-security.py -v (requires execstack, libcap2-bin)</code>

===== LTP =====

1. SSH into it

2. <code>sudo apt-get install ltp</code>

3. run <code>sudo /usr/lib/ltp/tools/runltp -f ltplite -l /var/cache/ltp/results/runltplite.log -o /var/cache/ltp/results/runltplite-results.txt</code>
